title: It would be great, if failed to resolve/unresolved import diagnostics suggested declaring modules

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur. 
-->

Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
// There is nothing with this name
use doesnt_exist_top::Item0;

// File exists, but there is no `mod ...;`
use no_mod::Item1;

// Same as above, but there is no file for foo
use foo::bar::baz;

#[cfg(test)]
mod tests {
    #[test]
    fn it_works() {
        assert_eq!(2 + 2, 4);
    }
}
```

And project structure: 

```text
src/
├── foo
│   └── bar.rs
├── lib.rs
└── no_mod.rs
```


The current (as of nightly `f5d8117c3` `2021-03-16`) output is:

```text
error[E0432]: unresolved import `doesnt_exist_top`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:5
  |
3 | use doesnt_exist_top::Item0;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `doesnt_exist_top`

error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `foo`
 --> src/lib.rs:9:5
  |
9 | use foo::bar::baz;
  |     ^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `foo`

error[E0432]: unresolved import `no_mod`
 --> src/lib.rs:6:5
  |
6 | use no_mod::Item1;
  |     ^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `no_mod`
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0432]: unresolved import `doesnt_exist_top`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:5
  |
3 | use doesnt_exist_top::Item0;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `doesnt_exist_top`
 help: you may want to create inline module: `mod doesnt_exist_top {}`

error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `foo`
 --> src/lib.rs:9:5
  |
9 | use foo::bar::baz;
  |     ^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `foo`
 help: directory `foo` exists, consider creating a module file `src/foo.rs`

error[E0432]: unresolved import `no_mod`
 --> src/lib.rs:6:5
  |
6 | use no_mod::Item1;
  |     ^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `no_mod`
 help: file with the same name exists, try declaring the module: `mod no_mod;`
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

<!--
If dramatically different output is caused by small changes, consider also
adding them here.

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions. The output might also be
different depending on the Edition.
-->
